      "content": "Infosys (NSE, BSE, NYSE: INFY), líder global en servicios digitales de próxima generación y consultoría, anunció hoy el lanzamiento de **Infosys Agentic AI Foundry**, una solución integral diseñada para acelerar el desarrollo y la implementación de agentes de IA confiables y listos para producción. El Agentic AI Foundry, parte de Infosys Topaz™, proporciona a las empresas una hoja de ruta estratégica para adoptar agentes de IA de manera responsable y ética, al tiempo que garantiza una arquitectura preparada para el futuro que se adapta a los avances en tecnología de IA. Con una arquitectura abierta que evita la dependencia tecnológica, el Foundry proporciona un camino claro y ético para que las empresas adopten la IA mientras se preparan para los avances futuros en el campo. Además, su interoperabilidad y eficiencia de costos lo convierten en una inversión sostenible para las empresas que buscan escalar sus capacidades de IA de manera responsable. Infosys Agentic AI Foundry tiene como objetivo transformar empresas en diversas industrias, permitiéndoles tomar decisiones críticas para el negocio y ayudándolas a aumentar exponencialmente su productividad. Por ejemplo, para una importante empresa tecnológica, Infosys implementó un agente de investigación profunda de aprendizaje continuo que proporciona información integral sobre productos en segundos, reduciendo los tiempos de resolución de soporte hasta en un 50 % y mejorando la satisfacción del cliente (CSAT) en un 24 %. De manera similar, para una empresa líder en servicios, los agentes de IA automatizaron procesos complejos de auditoría, incluyendo muestreo de transacciones, recopilación y revisión de documentos, mejorando la integridad de los registros financieros. Infosys está adoptando su enfoque centrado en la IA al integrar Agentic AI en sus propias operaciones para impulsar la eficiencia, la innovación y la rentabilidad. El enfoque de Infosys hacia la IA agente es un movimiento crucial para apoyar a las empresas que enfrentan una creciente presión para incorporar estas capacidades en las experiencias de sus empleados y clientes.\"* Infosys Agentic AI Foundry es un cambio de juego en la transformación empresarial, proporcionando un camino claro, ético y preparado para el futuro para aprovechar todo el potencial de la IA.",

      "content": "Infosys launcht Agentic AI Foundry, Teil von Infosys Topaz – und beschleunigt so die KI-Reise von Unternehmen Infosys launcht Agentic AI Foundry, Teil von Infosys Topaz – und beschleunigt so die KI-Reise von Unternehmen _Die Foundry ist auf die Entwicklung und den Einsatz von KI-Agenten für Unternehmen in zugeschnitten und verändert Firmen mit zuverlässigen und verantwortungsvollen Innovationen_ Infosys (NSE, BSE, NYSE: INFY), ein weltweit führender Anbieter von digitalen Dienstleistungen und Beratung der nächsten Generation, führt mit Infosys Agentic AI Foundry eine umfassende Lösung ein, die die Entwicklung und den Einsatz von zuverlässigen KI-Agenten in Produktionsqualität beschleunigt. Die Agentic AI Foundry, Teil von Infosys Topaz, bietet Unternehmen eine strategische Roadmap für den verantwortungsvollen und ethisch vertretbaren Einsatz von KI-Agenten. Organisationen sind so in der Lage, diese Agenten in beliebige interne oder externe Plattformen zu integrieren – und so eine schnellere Implementierung von KI-Lösungen zu gewährleisten. Insgesamt bietet die Foundry einen klaren und ethischen Weg für Unternehmen, um KI einzuführen und gleichzeitig für zukünftige Fortschritte in diesem Bereich gerüstet zu sein. Die Interoperabilität und Kosteneffizienz der Foundry machen sie zudem zu einer nachhaltigen Investition für Organisationen, die ihre KI-Fähigkeiten verantwortungsbewusst skalieren wollen. Mit Infosys Agentic AI Foundry sind Unternehmen in allen Branchen in der Lage, geschäftskritische Entscheidungen zu treffen und die Produktivität exponentiell zu steigern. Für einen großen Technologiekonzern implementiert Infosys beispielsweise einen kontinuierlich lernenden Deep-Research-Agenten, der in Sekundenschnelle umfassende Produkteinsichten liefert, die Support-Lösungszeiten um bis zu 50 Prozent reduziert und die Kundenzufriedenheit um 24 Prozent erhöht. Infosys' Agentic AI Ansatz ist ein wichtiger Schritt: Unternehmen stehen zunehmend unter Druck diese Fähigkeiten in ihre Mitarbeiter- und Kundenerfahrungen einzubinden. R. (Bali), Executive Vice President, Global Services Head, AI and Industry Verticals, Infosys, erläutert: „Bei Infosys sind wir der Meinung, dass die Zukunft der Innovation darin liegt, die Macht der KI verantwortungsvoll und effektiv zu nutzen. Infosys Agentic AI Foundry ist bei der Transformation von Unternehmen wichtig. Durch die nahtlose Integration von KI-Agenten über Ökosysteme hinweg sind Unternehmen in der Lage, schneller Innovationen zu entwickeln, intelligenter zu arbeiten und in einer sich wandelnden digitalen Welt zielgerichtet eine führende Position einzunehmen.“ If you do not allow these cookies we will not know when you have visited our site, and will not be able to monitor its performance.",

      "title": "Infosys Launches Agentic AI Foundry, Part of Infosys Topaz™, to Accelerate Enterprise AI Journey",
      "content": "# Infosys Launches Agentic AI Foundry, Part of Infosys Topaz™, to Accelerate Enterprise AI Journey. *Tailored to develop and deploy enterprise AI agents at scale, the Foundry aims to transform businesses with reliable and responsible innovation*. Infosys (NSE, BSE, NYSE: INFY), a global leader in next-generation digital services and consulting, today announced the launch of Infosys Agentic AI Foundry, a comprehensive solution designed to accelerate the development and deployment of reliable production-grade AI agents. The Agentic AI Foundry, part of Infosys Topaz™, provides enterprises a strategic roadmap to adopt AI agents responsibly and ethically, while ensuring a future-ready architecture that accommodates advancements in AI technology. It enables seamless integration of AI agents across business, operations, and IT ecosystems, driving faster decisions, improved customer experiences, and higher operational efficiency. Infosys Agentic AI Foundry brings together a comprehensive collection of reusable components, including a growing repository of pre-built horizontal and vertical agents, that will enable organizations to discover, shortlist, develop, deploy, monitor, and measure AI-driven initiatives effectively. The Agentic AI Foundry also allows organizations to build agents and customize pre-built agents to be adopted in their enterprise context. Infosys Agentic AI Foundry will aim to transform enterprises across industries, enabling them to take business critical decisions and helping them increase productivity exponentially. Infosys is embodying its AI-first approach by integrating Agentic AI into its own operations to drive efficiency, innovation, and cost-effectiveness. Infosys’ approach to Agentic AI is a critical move to support enterprises under increasing pressure to embed these capabilities into their employee and customer experiences.”. R. (Bali), Executive Vice President, Global Services Head, AI and Industry Verticals, Infosys,** said, “At Infosys, we believe the future of innovation lies in harnessing the power of AI responsibly and effectively. Infosys Agentic AI Foundry is a game-changer in enterprise transformation, providing a clear, ethical, and future-ready pathway to harness AI's full potential. By seamlessly integrating AI agents across ecosystems, we are enabling businesses to innovate faster, operate smarter, and lead with purpose in an evolving digital world.”.",

With one click, we create composite services that blend RPA, human-in-the-loop, and decision automation, giving our clients predictability and control at every step. Most importantly, the built-in governance ensures enterprise access is secure and fully managed across all agent ecosystems, so IT leaders can accelerate innovation with confidence.”_\n\nInfosys extends AI Agents with Oracle Integration MCP Tools [...] Secure, Scalable Connectivity: Predictable MCP tools enable Infosys to connect Fusion AI agents with external platforms such as Stripe or Salesforce. Oracle Integration customers can now create predictable MCP tools with a single click from their existing automations, with the unified observability, human oversight, and governance they need to scale their agentic initiatives.\n   Composite Workflows:Infosys uses the low-code Oracle Fusion Agent Studio and OCI Generative AI Agent Hub platforms to create and orchestrate specialized agents. With Oracle Integration MCP tools, these agents can now easily operate across the enterprise, automating complex workflows and reducing manual tasks. [...] Why MCP for Agentic AI and Why Now?\n\nTraditional AI agents often operate in silos, requiring manual workarounds to connect disparate systems and rarely realizing the full promise of automation. The vision of increasingly capable agentic AI ecosystems with lightweight, task-focused agents that leverage trusted tools for predictable enterprise application and data access enables true business transformation. Leading this shift, Infosys leverages a suite of Oracle tools, including Oracle Integration MCP, Fusion Agent Studio, OCI Generative AI, and the AI Data Platform.       "content": "# Building Ethical and Agentic AI Together. The future of AI is more than just innovation – it’s a responsibility. At Infosys and Microsoft, we believe in building AI systems grounded in ethics, transparency, and impactful results. Join us for an exclusive **two-episode fireside chat series** that unites distinguished women leaders from both Infosys and Microsoft. **Andrea Hendrickx**, **Lilly Vasanthini**, and **Asseneta Deliiska-Schreiber**, from **Infosys**, and **Marianne Röling**, from **Microsoft**, come together to share their unique perspectives, revealing how our collaboration is shaping the ethical future of AI. These capabilities make Google Agentspace foundational for enterprise AI systems, IoT ecosystems, and autonomous systems while paving the way for superior customer experiences. * **Insurance:** Intelligent underwriting and faster claims processing through agent collaboration. **Wipro: Pioneers of Next-Gen Agentic AI**. Wipro internally implemented Google Agentspace to optimize processes like invoicing, claims management, and support ticketing.       "url": "https://www.bcg.com/publications/2026/agentic-ai-power-core-insurance-ai-modernization",
      "title": "Agentic AI Can Power Core Insurance IT Modernization | BCG",
      "content": "Agentic AI copilots are now embedded throughout the software delivery lifecycle. They facilitate code generation, configuration, and integration activities in both platform-based and customized modernization programs. These AI-powered assistants can refactor and re-engineer legacy applications and automate code development and documentation. Most of the immediate productivity gains accrue to the software vendors and system integrators in the form of faster development and reduced rework. However, insurers can also capture part of these gains when they develop solutions in-house. They also gain indirectly, benefiting from lower project costs, faster delivery, and a higher quality implementation. (See “Revolutionizing Software Development and Code Translation.”) [...] In the design phase, agentic AI helps analyze requirements and map them to the architecture of the newly adopted software, thereby accelerating alignment between business needs and the standard software model. Agentic AI can also help analyze interviews with business and IT specialists (those with deep knowledge of the legacy systems and business rules). It then clusters requirements and simulates target-state options, clarifying the rationale in business logic and design choices. And while it doesn’t eliminate the need for strong human architectural oversight, agentic AI accelerates design iteration and consistency checks, helping to facilitate consensus on early-stage decisions regarding architecture and data structures.\n\nValue: Medium | Maturity: Medium [...] Understanding and documenting the legacy systems\n\nAI agents can analyze legacy applications (such as those based on COBOL), automatically extracting business rules, generating documentation, and creating process maps (including data-flow maps, visual flow diagrams, and nontechnical materials that explain how processes connect system-wide). This capability accelerates one of the toughest, most time-consuming steps in modernization: understanding how legacy systems actually work. AI agents reduce the reliance on subject matter experts whose time is at a premium—and whose numbers are rapidly decreasing due to retirement.\n\nValue: High | Maturity: Medium",

      "title": "Agentic AI in HR | Strategy&",
      "content": "Click to increase view\n\n Activate to open full-size image in lightbox overlay\n\nThe focus on automation, AI and digital spend shows that the pivot to AI is already underway, with the center of gravity shifting from on-demand content generation to autonomy and orchestration directly serving business goals, or as we call it: agentification of processes.\n\n## What is agentic AI, and why the hype?\n\nAgentic AI refers to intelligent software that autonomously makes decisions and acts upon it to achieve defined goals without continuous human input. It operates around the clock, learns from its environment, and adapts as conditions change. In HR, its power lies in how it combines three complementary capability levers:\n\n 1 [...] 1\n\n  Transactional automation accelerates repetitive, rule-based tasks to reduce errors and cost\n 2\n\n  Strategic augmentation supports human decisions with real-time insights for better strategy and planning\n 3\n\n  Central orchestration coordinates complex workflows across systems for real-time, end-to-end execution\n\nTraditional generative tools excel at creating content from prompts but remain reactive. Agentic AI builds on these capabilities by adding goal-directed reasoning, persistent memory, and the ability to plan and execute actions within defined guardrails. In practice, this transforms static outputs into dynamic workflows that continuously learn from human feedback. [...] ## What good looks like in practice\n\nLeading HR functions are already piloting focused agentic AI solutions that can be scaled to end-to-end workflows if successful.\n\nThe infographic depicts how Agentic AI supports the sourcing process. HR employees define requirements, review candidate pools, prioritize candidates, and manage communication. AI agents automate profile optimization, data collection and evaluation, shortlist adjustments, and two-way communication, using Robotic Process Automation (RPA), analytical AI, and generative AI. The potential improvement is up to 90% reduction in time-to-hire. \n\nClick to increase view\n\n Activate to open full-size image in lightbox overlay\n\n## Foundations for enablement and the realities of scale",

As a Senior Analyst within the Digital & AI Transformation team, you will report to a **Manager** in the team and collaborate closely with **case teams** and **topic leaders** (Partners and MDPs). You’ll work with colleagues across BCG’s TDA network, combining cutting-edge AI, analytics, and digital expertise with strategic insights to deliver client and practice impact. It equips BCG case teams and clients with cutting-edge expertise, proprietary assets, actionable data, and transformative insights that empower our case teams and enable our clients to achieve their aspirations. With global experts across 20 Practices, covering more than 100 topics, sectors and offers, plus four focused geographic markets, BCG Vantage delivers unparalleled depth and breadth of insight & expertise. BCG Vantage consists of three career paths, each playing a crucial role in delivering value to clients, case teams and practice teams. * Combines deep domain insights with our know-how and proprietary assets to address targeted challenges directly with clients and project teams; co-creates insights on industry trends and functional topics, proprietary data and tools, and teams to codify IP that all enables BCG to deliver excellent business value with its clients.       "title": "Generative AI can make HR more ‘human,’ not less—Bain & Company | Bain & Company",
      "content": "The study suggests that selecting the right roles for automation and AI interventions could, on average, save around 15-20% in HR labor time. According to Bain’s Generative AI Workforce Impact Explorer tool, HR business partners could save up to 15% of employee time through AI; talent acquisition teams can save up to 20%; and HR operations teams up to 35%. [...] “HR is at a critical juncture. The function is under pressure to become both more cost efficient and more strategic. That is a challenging balance to strike,” said John Hazan, a partner at Bain & Company and global head of the firm’s Talent solution. “Generative AI has the power to elevate HR’s role in the organization, from transactional operators to strategic advisers. Our analysis suggests a typical company could save, on average, up to 20% in HR labor time through AI automation and augmentation.” [...] According to Bain, HR leaders will be able to reinvent their teams’ structure and skills once transactional processes are streamlined through technology.       "url": "https://bain.com/insights/building-the-foundation-for-agentic-ai-technology-report-2025",
      "title": "Building the Foundation for Agentic AI | Bain & Company",
      "content": "As executives reflect on how agentic AI might shape their business, from competitive positioning to their talent model, they will have to consider how it challenges the fundamentals of their IT architecture. Agentic AI architecture builds on the rise of composable microservices architecture and the use of enterprise cloud services that many companies have already been investing in. But to fully capture the value while navigating the risks, they will need to rethink how AI is embedded across the architecture—the systems, processes, and governance. Enterprises need to ensure agents have the context they need in real time, the ability to observe and explain behavior, and the guardrails to execute safely, securely, and cost-effectively. Current architectures simply cannot handle this balance [...] Companies that don’t want to fall behind should be preparing and investing now: hiring and upskilling teams, embedding new capabilities, and understanding the necessary architectural changes. Those that wait will struggle to catch up. Agentic AI is already reshaping the enterprise, and only those that move decisively—redesigning their architecture, teams, and ways of working—will unlock its full value.\n\nDavid Crawford, chairman of Bain & Company’s Global Technology, Media, and Telecommunications practice; Anne Hoecker, global leader of the TMT practice; and Dana Aulanier, practice vice president of the TMT practice, prepared this report. [...] Reimagine agent experience and access. In this new framework, agents become first-class channels and citizens. As channels, they are emerging as primary interfaces for interacting with customers and employees—on par with websites, mobile apps, and call centers. As citizens, they are fully embedded participants in business operations, empowered to act, make decisions, and collaborate across systems. This demands a reimagining of experience design: Conversational interfaces will dominate human engagement, while agent-to-agent coordination will drive autonomous action across workflows, systems, and even organizational boundaries. To make this work at scale—and safely—enterprises must establish robust frameworks for identity, consent, and fine-grained access control. For example, a South",

Previous waves of automation tackled parts of processes, leaving exceptions where humans had to step in. AI agents can reason, collaborate, and coordinate actions, allowing them to accomplish complex, multistep, nondeterministic processes that have so far depended on humans.\n\nIt’s easy to see the transformative potential of this, from improved operational efficiency and customer experience to sharper decision making and beyond. Forward-looking leaders aren’t asking if agentic AI will reshape their business but how to prepare their organizations to deploy it safely and effectively.",

      "title": "Agentic AI poised to disrupt retail, even with 50% of consumers cautious of fully autonomous purchases—Bain & Company | Bain & Company",
      "content": "Agentic AI, which combines memory, reasoning, and tool use to act semi- or fully autonomously across the shopping journey, is ready to emerge as a retail disrupter. AI now accounts for up to 25% of referral traffic for some retailers, though it is still less than 1% of total traffic, according to Bain’s research in partnership with Similarweb. Of the three types of AI agents – third-party “objective” agents (e.g. ChatGPT, Perplexity), on-site retailer agents, and off-site retailer agents – third-party agents threaten to disintermediate retailers most. Consumers currently trust retailers’ on-site agents three times more, though the trust gap could close as more consumers try utilizing third-party agents. [...] “Agentic AI marks a major shift in retail discovery and loyalty since the rise of search engines,” said Aaron Cheris, partner in Bain’s Retail practice. “These systems are beginning to act independently across the shopping journey, from product research to checkout, creating both disruption and opportunity for retailers. This is the moment to strengthen customer relationships, build trust, and make retailer-value obvious —to humans and to algorithms alike.”\n\nWinning retailers will strategically decide how to participate in the Agentic AI emergence by either building their own agentic capabilities, or by strategically collaborating with major AI platforms, finds Bain. Agility will be crucial as the rules of engagement evolve.
